result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Klade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling, or a combination of both of 30 hours per week and if not then must complete 3 verifiable/appropriate job searches and 5 hours of community service per week.

Complete SAFE program and any counseling as deemed appropriate.
Complete psycho/sexual evaluation, participate in any evaluations or counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
Sex Offender Registration is not ordered at this time, however if defendant is revoked from probation then Sex Offender Registration will be ordered. 
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
On objection for defendant to have contact with wife, A.K.
2 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 11:05 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt for DDA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Julie Sawyer. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.  VRCW.
State files Amended Information. COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: Ct.1- 4th Deg. Sex. Assault (Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST 
           Ct.2- 4th Deg. Sex. Assault (Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST
           Ct.3- Obstructing an Officer>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: Ct.1 & Ct.2- SWH, 3 years probation. Ct.3- SWH, 2 years probation concurrent to Ct.1 & Ct.2. CONDITIONS: Complete SAFE program and any counseling as deemed appropriate, complete psycho/sexual evaluation, participate in any evauluations or counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both for 30 hours per week and if not, complete 3 verifiable/appropriate job searches and 5 hours CS per week, DNA sample and surcharge, 2 DA surcharges & CC.
SOR is not ordered at this time, however if defendant's probation is revoked, SOR will be ordered. Defendant is entitled to 2 days credit if defendant is revoked. 
COURT has no objection for defendant to have contact with wife, A.K. 
Adj: 11:17 a.m.
Plea hearing on May 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on May 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on April 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  A.K.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  Third party exchange of children through Family Resource Center.
